ProposalInformation.Title: OTE-07 Global Alignment 1
ProposalInformation.Abstract:
Purpose: Reduce the observed segment level WFE by refining the Secondary Mirror position and making coarse corrections for all PMSAs.
There will be 26 observations for the selected target. Observation 1 contains the initial global alignment visit. Observations 2-21 are on HOLD until WFSC scientist decides which ones to execute. Observations 2/3, 4/5, 6/7, 8/9, and 10/11 contains visit pairs for a global alignment iteration with a bore-sight change, and Observations 12 to 21 each contain a visit needed for a global alignment iteration without a bore-sight change. Observation 22 returns SM to best focus position. It is not expected that any radial translation type moves will be issued until Global Alignment 2; the observations for those types of moves are described in that PIF.
Each of those Observations consists of one visit.
Observations 23-26 consist of contingency visits using the NIRCam Imaging template for two different cases where additional data might be needed to support the GA process. It is not expected that these contingency observations will actually be needed but they are prepared in this program just in case. Obs 23 and 24 are single pointings of NIRCam imaging, to get repeat images in case of guide star acquisition problems during any instance of the GA template. Obs 25 and 26 are small mosaics in case mechanism uncertainties result in any segment PSFs moving off the edge of the NIRCam FOV (e.g. into the intramodule gap) and need to be re-located.
ProposalInformation.ObservingDescription:
-------------------- Purpose: -------------------- Reduce the observed segment level WFE by refining the Secondary Mirror position and making coarse corrections for all PMSAs.
-------------------- Rationale: --------------------
-------------------- Description: -------------------- Pre-requisites: OTE Segment Image Array-1 (Large) has been executed. Rationale: Segments must be in image array to take GA measurements.
FGS initial checkout has been completed. CAR FGS-001 and CAR FGS-002 (Aliveness and Functional), and CARs LOS-1 and LOS-2 for to enable FGS+ACS line of sight tracking control. Rationale: Image motion must be less than 0.1 arcsec. FGS TRACK should provide this stability.
FGS table parameters should be updated if necessary to allow tracking on unstacked, defocused segments. Rationale: Same as prior paragraph.
The FGS, ISIM, and OTE backplane must be cooling at a rate <= 0.1 K/hr. Rationale: See Ball memo “Temperature Stability Requirements for Each Phase of the Commissioning Process” by D. S. Acton.
Target Description: Target list: List of stars that ensure that there is only one isolated target in the NIRCam Module A SCA 3 FOV and only one target in a GUIDER FOV; Ensure that any NIRCam neighboring stars within a radius of at least 2.5 arcmin are 7 magnitudes dimmer than the target star. No FGS neighbors within 3 FGS mag of guide star with some distance TBD.
Nominally K~5, SBR > 500 in F212N images on single segments with substantial defocus. One list of NIRCam targets and an associated list of FGS guide stars. We label this list as the “Global Alignment” target list.
Target Position: For the FGS image: Place guide star at center of the guider FOV For the GA visits: Center location in NIRCam Module A SCA 3 FOV (SIAF “NIRCA3_FULL”)
Exposures, PSFs, and SNR Required SBR > 500 Isolation criteria as noted above PSFs change significantly during this proposal: • Single segments unstacked, highly aberrated • Single segments unstacked, defocused (by ~100 µm?) • Single segments unstacked, well focused (by the end of this program) Therefore the exposure parameters need to be chosen to allow higher dynamic range on a wide range of PSF morphologies, even within a single exposure.
Pointing stability requirements: PCS MODE = TRACK
Observation & Visit Specifications:
There will be 26 observations for the selected target. Observation 1 contains the initial global alignment visit. Observations 2-21 are on HOLD until WFSC scientist decides which ones to execute. Observations 2/3, 4/5, 6/7, 8/9, and 10/11 contains visit pairs for a global alignment iteration with a bore-sight change, and Observations 12 to 21 each contain a visit needed for a global alignment iteration without a bore-sight change. Observation 22 returns SM to best focus position. It is not expected that any radial translation type moves will be issued until Global Alignment 2; the observations for those types of moves are described in that PIF.
Each of those Observations consists of one visit.
Observations 23-26 consist of contingency visits using the NIRCam Imaging template for two different cases where additional data might be needed to support the GA process. It is not expected that these contingency observations will actually be needed but they are prepared in this program just in case. Obs 23 and 24 are single pointings of NIRCam imaging, to get repeat images in case of guide star acquisition problems during any instance of the GA template. Obs 25 and 26 are small mosaics in case mechanism uncertainties result in any segment PSFs moving off the edge of the NIRCam FOV (e.g. into the intramodule gap) and need to be re-located.
Setup before Observation 1: Based on the FGS images obtained in the FGS LOS-1 and LOS-2 activities, if needed update the guide star info using Segment-Guide-Star Tool for the following observation to include the 18 segment PSFs as “guide stars” in the preferred order. The science attitude is known because the alignment between the NIRCam and FGSs, as well as the astrometry relative to NIRCam target is accurate enough.
-------------------- Notes / Open Questions: -------------------- - This OTE step requires a custom list of guide stars for the FGS. Will perform segment guiding and use the segment GS tool, which is currently being refined. - The Guide Star ID and the PA range values are not set in stone. These will be determined once the date of observation is known. The Guide Star should be chosen such that the PA is near the nominal angle. Once the GS is known, the PA range SR value can be set. - Have set NGROUPS=4, NINTS=4 to ensure sufficient dynamic range. Target list may be modified at a future date to ensure that we don't saturate.
